org.apache.juneau.examples.rest.petstore

Class AbstractPersistenceService

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.examples.rest.petstore.AbstractPersistenceService
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PetStoreService

    public class AbstractPersistenceService
extends Object
    Superclass for DAOs that use the JPA entity manager.

      • getEntityManager

        protected EntityManager getEntityManager()
        Retrieves an entity manager session.
        Returns:
        The entity manager session.

      • find

        protected <T> T find(EntityManager em,
                     Class<T> t,
                     Object id)
        Retrieves the specified JPA bean from the repository.
        Parameters:
        em - The entity manager to use to retrieve the bean.
        t - The bean type to retrieve.
        id - The primary key value.
        Returns:
        The JPA bean, or null if not found.

      • find

        protected <T> T find(Class<T> t,
                     Object id)
        Same as find(EntityManager, Class, Object) but uses a new entity manager.
        Parameters:
        t - The bean type to retrieve.
        id - The primary key value.
        Returns:
        The JPA bean, or null if not found.

      • merge

        protected <T> T merge(EntityManager em,
                      T t)
        Store the specified JPA bean in the repository.
        Parameters:
        em - The entity manager to use to store and merge the bean.
        t - The bean to store.
        Returns:
        The merged JPA bean returned by the EntityManager.merge(Object) method, or null if the bean was null.

      • merge

        protected <T> T merge(T t)
        Same as merge(EntityManager, Object) but uses a new entity manager.
        Parameters:
        t - The bean to store.
        Returns:
        The merged JPA bean returned by the EntityManager.merge(Object) method, or null if the bean was null.

      • merge

        protected <T> Collection<T> merge(EntityManager em,
                                  Collection<T> c)
        Store the specified JPA beans in the repository. All values are persisted in the same transaction.
        Parameters:
        em - The entity manager to use to store and merge the beans.
        c - The collection of beans to store.
        Returns:
        The merged JPA beans returned by the EntityManager.merge(Object) method.

      • merge

        protected <T> Collection<T> merge(Collection<T> c)
        Same as merge(EntityManager, Collection) but uses a new entity manager.
        Parameters:
        c - The collection of beans to store.
        Returns:
        The merged JPA beans returned by the EntityManager.merge(Object) method.

      • remove

        protected <T> void remove(Class<T> t,
                          Object id)
        Remove the specified JPA bean from the repository.
        Parameters:
        t - The bean type to remove.
        id - The primary key value.

      • remove

        protected <T> void remove(EntityManager em,
                          T t)
        Remove the specified JPA bean from the repository.
        Parameters:
        em - The entity manager used to retrieve the bean.
        t - The bean to remove. Can be null.

      • query

        Runs a JPA query and returns the results.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The bean type.
        Parameters:
        em - The entity manager to use to retrieve the beans.
        query - The JPA query.
        t - The bean type.
        searchArgs - Optional search arguments.
        Returns:
        The results.

      • update

        protected int update(EntityManager em,
                     String query)
        Runs a JPA update statement.
        Parameters:
        em - The entity manager to use to run the statement.
        query - The JPA update statement.
        Returns:
        The number of rows modified.

      • update

        protected int update(String query)
        Same as update(EntityManager,String) but uses a new entity manager.
        Parameters:
        query - The JPA update statement.
        Returns:
        The number of rows modified.

      • update

        protected int update(EntityManager em,
                     String query,
                     Map<String,Object> params)
        Runs a JPA parameterized update statement.
        Parameters:
        em - The entity manager to use to run the statement.
        query - The JPA update statement.
        params - The query parameter values.
        Returns:
        The number of rows modified.
